alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 28 at 8:56PM PDT until September 04 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot and humid conditions with temperatures in the 80s at the beaches and 90 to 95 for locations just inland from the immediate coast possible. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Humidity will increase through the week. Lows temperatures will only fall into the 70 to 75 degree range each night.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
